forms.FormApp.name: FormApp
forms.FormApp.doc: FormApp Allows a script to open existing Forms or create new ones. // Open a form by ID. var existingForm = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); // Create and open a form. var newForm = FormApp.create('Form Name');

property.name: Alignment
property.doc: An enumeration of types of image alignment.

property.name: DestinationType
property.doc: An enumeration of types of destinations that can store form responses.

property.name: ItemType
property.doc: An enumeration of types of form Items.

property.name: PageNavigationType
property.doc: An enumeration of possible behaviors for navigating pages.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates and returns a new Form.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the name of the new form

method.name: getActiveForm
method.doc: Returns the form to which the script is container-bound.

method.name: getUi
method.doc: Returns an instance of the form editor's user-interface environment that allows the script to add features like menus, dialogs, and sidebars.

method.name: openById
method.doc: Returns the Form with the specified ID.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the ID of the form to open

method.name: openByUrl
method.doc: Returns the Form with the specified URL.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the URL of the form to open

forms.CheckboxItem.name: CheckboxItem
forms.CheckboxItem.doc: CheckboxItem A question item that allows the respondent to select one or more checkboxes, as well as an optional "other" field. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new checkbox item. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var item = form.addCheckboxItem(); item.setTitle('What condiments would you like on your hot dog?') .setChoices([ item.createChoice('Ketchup'), item.createChoice('Mustard'), item.createChoice('Relish') ]) .showOtherOption(true);

method.name: createChoice
method.doc: Creates a new choice.

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the choice's value, which respondents see as a label when viewing the form

method.name: createResponse
method.doc: Creates a new ItemResponse for this checkbox item.

argument.name: responses
argument.doc: an array of valid answers for this multiple-choice item

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.name: getChoices
method.doc: Gets all choices for an item.

method.name: getHelpText
method.doc: Gets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the item's unique identifier.

method.name: getIndex
method.doc: Gets the index of the item among all the items in the form.

method.name: getTitle
method.doc: Gets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the item's type, represented as an ItemType.

method.name: hasOtherOption
method.doc: Determines whether the item has an "other" option.

method.name: isRequired
method.doc: Determines whether the respondent must answer the question.

method.name: setChoiceValues
method.doc: Sets the choices for an item from an array of strings.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: the array of choice values, which respondents see as labels when viewing the form

method.name: setChoices
method.doc: Sets an array of choices for an item.

argument.name: choices
argument.doc: an array of choices

method.name: setHelpText
method.doc: Sets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

argument.name: text
argument.doc: the new help text

method.name: setRequired
method.doc: Sets whether the respondent must answer the question.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: whether the respondent must answer the question

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the new title or header text

method.name: showOtherOption
method.doc: Sets whether the item has an "other" option.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: true if the item has an "other" option; false if not

forms.Choice.name: Choice
forms.Choice.doc: Choice A single choice associated with a type of Item that supports choices, like CheckboxItem, ListItem, or MultipleChoiceItem. // Create a new form and add a multiple-choice item. var form = FormApp.create('Form Name'); var item = form.addMultipleChoiceItem(); item.setTitle('Do you prefer cats or dogs?') .setChoices([ item.createChoice('Cats', FormApp.PageNavigationType.CONTINUE), item.createChoice('Dogs', FormApp.PageNavigationType.RESTART) ]); // Add another page because navigation has no effect on the last page. form.addPageBreakItem().setTitle('You chose well!'); // Log the navigation types that each choice results in. var choices = item.getChoices(); for (var i = 0; i < choices.length; i++) { Logger.log('If the respondent chooses "%s", the form will %s.', choices[i].getValue(), choices[i].getPageNavigationType()); }

method.name: getGotoPage
method.doc: Gets the PageBreakItem set as a GO_TO_PAGE destination if the responder selects this choice and completes the current page.

method.name: getPageNavigationType
method.doc: Gets the PageNavigationType that occurs if the responder selects this choice and completes the current page.

method.name: getValue
method.doc: Gets the choice's value, which respondents see as a label when viewing the form.

forms.DateItem.name: DateItem
forms.DateItem.doc: DateItem A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new date item. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var item = form.addDateItem(); item.setTitle('When were you born?');

method.name: createResponse
method.doc: Creates a new ItemResponse for this date item.

argument.name: response
argument.doc: a Date object that represents a month, day, and possibly year

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.name: getHelpText
method.doc: Gets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the item's unique identifier.

method.name: getIndex
method.doc: Gets the index of the item among all the items in the form.

method.name: getTitle
method.doc: Gets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the item's type, represented as an ItemType.

method.name: includesYear
method.doc: Determines whether the date item includes a year option.

method.name: isRequired
method.doc: Determines whether the respondent must answer the question.

method.name: setHelpText
method.doc: Sets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

argument.name: text
argument.doc: the new help text

method.name: setIncludesYear
method.doc: Sets whether the date item includes a year setting.

argument.name: enableYear
argument.doc: true if the date includes a year setting; false if not

method.name: setRequired
method.doc: Sets whether the respondent must answer the question.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: whether the respondent must answer the question

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the new title or header text

forms.DateTimeItem.name: DateTimeItem
forms.DateTimeItem.doc: DateTimeItem A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date and time. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new date-time item. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var item = form.addDateTimeItem(); item.setTitle('When do you want to meet?');

method.name: createResponse
method.doc: Creates a new ItemResponse for this date-time item.

argument.name: response
argument.doc: a Date object that represents a month, day, hour, minute, and possibly year

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.doc: Gets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

method.doc: Gets the index of the item among all the items in the form.

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the item's type, represented as an ItemType.

method.name: includesYear
method.doc: Determines whether the date item includes a year option.

method.name: isRequired

method.name: setHelpText
method.doc: Sets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

argument.name: text

forms.DurationItem.name: DurationItem
forms.DurationItem.doc: DurationItem A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a length of time. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new duration item. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var item = form.addDurationItem(); item.setTitle('How long can you hold your breath?');

method.name: createResponse
method.doc: Creates a new ItemResponse for this date item.

argument.name: hours
argument.doc: the hours, represented as an integer from 0 to 72

argument.name: minutes
argument.doc: the minutes, represented as an integer from 0 to 59

argument.name: seconds
argument.doc: the seconds, represented as an integer from 0 to 59

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.name: getHelpText

forms.Form.name: Form
forms.Form.doc: Form A form that contains overall properties (such as title, settings, and where responses are stored) and items (which includes question items like checkboxes and layout items like page breaks). Forms can be accessed or created from FormApp. // Open a form by ID and create a new spreadsheet. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var ss = SpreadsheetApp.create('Spreadsheet Name'); // Update form properties via chaining. form.setTitle('Form Name') .setDescription('Description of form') .setConfirmationMessage('Thanks for responding!') .setAllowResponseEdits(true) .setAcceptingResponses(false); // Update the form's response destination. form.setDestination(FormApp.DestinationType.SPREADSHEET, ss.getId());

method.name: addCheckboxItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to select one or more checkboxes, as well as an optional "other" field.

method.name: addDateItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date.

method.name: addDateTimeItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date and time.

method.name: addDurationItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to indicate a length of time.

method.name: addEditor
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of editors for the Form.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: the email address of the user to add

method.name: addEditor
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of editors for the Form.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user to add

method.name: addEditors
method.doc: Adds the given array of users to the list of editors for the Form.

argument.name: emailAddresses
argument.doc: an array of email addresses of the users to add

method.name: addGridItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item, presented as a grid of columns and rows, that allows the respondent to select one choice per row from a sequence of radio buttons.

method.name: addImageItem
method.doc: Appends a new layout item that displays an image.

method.name: addListItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a drop-down list.

method.name: addMultipleChoiceItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a list of radio buttons or an optional "other" field.

method.name: addPageBreakItem
method.doc: Appends a new layout item that marks the start of a page.

method.name: addParagraphTextItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to enter a block of text.

method.name: addScaleItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to choose one option from a numbered sequence of radio buttons.

method.name: addSectionHeaderItem
method.doc: Appends a new layout item that visually indicates the start of a section.

method.name: addTextItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to enter a single line of text.

method.name: addTimeItem
method.doc: Appends a new question item that allows the respondent to indicate a time of day.

method.name: addVideoItem
method.doc: Appends a new layout item that displays a video.

method.name: canEditResponse
method.doc: Determines whether the form displays a link to edit a response after submitting it.

method.name: collectsEmail
method.doc: Determines whether the form collects respondents' email addresses.

method.name: createResponse
method.doc: Creates a new response to the form.

method.name: deleteAllResponses
method.doc: Deletes all submitted responses from the form's response store.

method.name: deleteItem
method.doc: Deletes the item at a given index among all the items in the form.

argument.name: index
argument.doc: the index of the item among all the items in the form

method.name: deleteItem
method.doc: Deletes the given item.

argument.name: item
argument.doc: the item to be deleted

method.name: getConfirmationMessage
method.doc: Gets the form's confirmation message.

method.name: getCustomClosedFormMessage
method.doc: Gets the custom message that will be displayed if the form is not accepting responses, or an empty string if no custom message has been set.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Gets the form's description.

method.name: getDestinationId
method.doc: Gets the ID of the form's response destination.

method.name: getDestinationType
method.doc: Gets the type of the form's response destination.

method.name: getEditUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL that can be used to access the form's edit mode.

method.name: getEditors
method.doc: Gets the list of editors for this Form.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the ID of the form.

method.name: getItemById
method.doc: Gets the item with a given ID.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the item's ID

method.name: getItems
method.doc: Gets an array of all items in the form.

method.name: getItems
method.doc: Gets an array of all items of a given type.

argument.name: itemType
argument.doc: the type of items to retrieve

method.name: getPublishedUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL that can be used to respond to the form.

method.name: getResponse
method.doc: Gets a single form response based on its response ID.

argument.name: responseId
argument.doc: the ID for the form response

method.name: getResponses
method.doc: Gets an array of all of the form's responses.

method.name: getResponses
method.doc: Gets an array of all of the form's responses after a given date and time.

argument.name: timestamp
argument.doc: the earliest date and time for which form responses should be returned

method.name: getSummaryUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL that can be used to view a summary of the form's responses.

method.name: getTitle
method.doc: Gets the form's title.

method.name: hasProgressBar
method.doc: Determines whether the form displays a progress bar.

method.name: hasRespondAgainLink
method.doc: Determines whether the form displays a link to submit another response after a respondent completes the form.

method.name: isAcceptingResponses
method.doc: Determines whether the form is currently accepting responses.

method.name: isPublishingSummary
method.doc: Determines whether the form displays a link to view a summary of responses after a respondent completes the form.

method.name: moveItem
method.doc: Moves an item at a given index among all the items in the form to another given index.

argument.name: from
argument.doc: the current index of the item among all the items in the form

argument.name: to
argument.doc: the new index for the item among all the items in the form

method.name: moveItem
method.doc: Moves a given item to an given index among all the items in the form.

argument.name: item
argument.doc: the item to move

argument.name: toIndex
argument.doc: the new index for the item among all the items in the form

method.name: removeDestination
method.doc: Unlinks the form from its current response destination.

method.name: removeEditor
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of editors for the Form.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: the email address of the user to remove

method.name: removeEditor
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of editors for the Form.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user to remove

method.name: requiresLogin
method.doc: Determines whether the form requires respondents to log in to an account in the same domain or a subdomain before responding.

method.name: setAcceptingResponses
method.doc: Sets whether the form is currently accepting responses.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: true if the form should accept responses; false if not

method.name: setAllowResponseEdits
method.doc: Sets whether the form displays a link to edit a response after submitting it.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: true if the form should display an "Edit your response" link; false if not

method.name: setCollectEmail
method.doc: Sets whether the form collects respondents' email addresses.

argument.name: collect
argument.doc: true if the form should collect email addresses; false if not

method.name: setConfirmationMessage
method.doc: Sets the form's confirmation message.

argument.name: message
argument.doc: the form's new confirmation message

method.name: setCustomClosedFormMessage
method.doc: Sets the message to display if the form is not accepting responses.

argument.name: message
argument.doc: the message to display if the form is not accepting responses

method.name: setDescription
method.doc: Sets the form's description.

argument.name: description
argument.doc: the form's new description

method.name: setDestination
method.doc: Sets the destination where form responses are saved.

argument.name: type
argument.doc: the type of the form's response destination

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the ID of the form's response destination

method.name: setProgressBar
method.doc: Sets whether the form has a progress bar.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: true if the form should display a progress bar; false if not

method.name: setPublishingSummary
method.doc: Sets whether the form displays a link to view a summary of responses after a respondent submits the form.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: true if the form should display a "See previous responses" link; false if not

method.name: setRequireLogin
method.doc: Sets whether the form requires respondents to log in to an account in the same domain or a subdomain before responding.

argument.name: requireLogin
argument.doc: true if the form requires users to log in; false if not

method.name: setShowLinkToRespondAgain
method.doc: Sets whether the form displays a link to submit another response after a respondent completes the form.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: true if the form should display a "Submit another response" link; false if not

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the form's title.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the form's new title

forms.FormResponse.name: FormResponse
forms.FormResponse.doc: FormResponse A response to the form as a whole. Form responses have three main uses: they contain the answers submitted by a respondent (see getItemResponses(), they can be used to programmatically respond to the form (see withItemResponse(response) and submit()), and they can be used as a template to create a URL for the form with pre-filled answers. Form responses can be created or accessed from a Form. // Open a form by ID and log the responses to each question. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var formResponses = form.getResponses(); for (var i = 0; i < formResponses.length; i++) { var formResponse = formResponses[i]; var itemResponses = formResponse.getItemResponses(); for (var j = 0; j < itemResponses.length; j++) { var itemResponse = itemResponses[j]; Logger.log('Response #%s to the question "%s" was "%s"', (i + 1).toString(), itemResponse.getItem().getTitle(), itemResponse.getResponse()); } }

method.name: getEditResponseUrl
method.doc: Generates a URL that can be used to edit a response that has already been submitted, even if the Form.setAllowResponseEdits(enabled) setting is disabled.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the ID of the form response.

method.name: getItemResponses
method.doc: Gets all item responses contained in this form response, in the same order as the items appear in the form.

method.name: getRespondentEmail
method.doc: Gets the email address of the person who submitted this response, if the Form.setCollectEmail(collect) setting is enabled.

method.name: getResponseForItem
method.doc: Gets the item response contained in this form response for a given item.

method.name: getTimestamp
method.doc: Gets the timestamp at which this response was submitted.

method.name: submit
method.doc: Submits the response.

method.name: toPrefilledUrl
method.doc: Generates a URL for the form in which the answers are pre-filled based on the answers in this form response.

method.name: withItemResponse
method.doc: Adds an item response to this form response.

forms.GridItem.name: GridItem
forms.GridItem.doc: GridItem A question item, presented as a grid of columns and rows, that allows the respondent to select one choice per row from a sequence of radio buttons. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new grid item. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var item = form.addGridItem(); item.setTitle('Rate your interests') .setRows(['Cars', 'Computers', 'Celebrities']) .setColumns(['Boring', 'So-so', 'Interesting']);

method.name: createResponse
method.doc: Creates a new ItemResponse for this grid item.

argument.name: responses
argument.doc: an array of valid answers for this grid item

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.name: getColumns
method.doc: Gets the values for every column in the grid.

method.name: getHelpText
method.doc: Gets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the item's unique identifier.

method.name: getIndex
method.doc: Gets the index of the item among all the items in the form.

method.name: getRows
method.doc: Gets the values for every row in the grid.

method.name: getTitle
method.doc: Gets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the item's type, represented as an ItemType.

method.name: isRequired
method.doc: Determines whether the respondent must answer the question.

method.name: setColumns
method.doc: Sets the columns of the grid based on an array of values.

argument.name: columns
argument.doc: an array of column values, which respondents see as labels when viewing the form

method.name: setHelpText
method.doc: Sets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

argument.name: text
argument.doc: the new help text

method.name: setRequired
method.doc: Sets whether the respondent must answer the question.

argument.name: enabled
argument.doc: whether the respondent must answer the question

method.name: setRows
method.doc: Sets the rows of the grid based on an array of values.

argument.name: rows
argument.doc: an array of row values, which respondents see as labels when viewing the form

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the new title or header text

forms.ImageItem.name: ImageItem
forms.ImageItem.doc: ImageItem A layout item that displays an image. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new image item var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var img = UrlFetchApp.fetch('https://www.google.com/images/srpr/logo4w.png'); form.addImageItem() .setTitle('Google') .setHelpText('Google Logo') // The help text is the image description .setImage(img);

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.name: getAlignment
method.doc: Gets the image's horizontal alignment.

method.name: getHelpText
method.doc: Gets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the item's unique identifier.

method.name: getImage
method.doc: Gets the image that is currently assigned to the item.

method.name: getIndex
method.doc: Gets the index of the item among all the items in the form.

method.name: getTitle
method.doc: Gets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the item's type, represented as an ItemType.

method.name: getWidth
method.doc: Gets the image's width in pixels.

method.name: setAlignment
method.doc: Sets the image's horizontal alignment.

argument.name: alignment
argument.doc: the horizontal alignment

method.name: setHelpText
method.doc: Sets the item's help text (sometimes called description text for layout items like ImageItems, PageBreakItems, and SectionHeaderItems).

argument.name: text
argument.doc: the new help text

method.name: setImage
method.doc: Sets the image itself.

argument.name: image
argument.doc: the image data

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the item's title (sometimes called header text, in the case of a SectionHeaderItem).

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the new title or header text

method.name: setWidth
method.doc: Sets the image's width in pixels.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the width in pixels

forms.Item.name: Item
forms.Item.doc: Item A generic form item that contains properties common to all items, such as title and help text. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. To operate on type-specific properties, use getType() to check the item's ItemType, then cast the item to the appropriate class using a method like asCheckboxItem(). // Create a new form and add a text item. var form = FormApp.create('Form Name'); form.addTextItem(); // Access the text item as a generic item. var items = form.getItems(); var item = items[0]; // Cast the generic item to the text-item class. if (item.getType() == 'TEXT') { var textItem = item.asTextItem(); textItem.setRequired(false); }

method.name: asCheckboxItem
method.doc: Returns the item as a checkbox item.

method.name: asDateItem
method.doc: Returns the item as a date item.

method.name: asDateTimeItem
method.doc: Returns the item as a date-time item.

method.name: asDurationItem
method.doc: Returns the item as a duration item.

forms.ItemResponse.name: ItemResponse
forms.ItemResponse.doc: ItemResponse A response to one question item within a form. Item responses can be accessed from FormResponse and created from any Item that asks the respondent to answer a question. // Open a form by ID and log the responses to each question. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var formResponses = form.getResponses(); for (var i = 0; i < formResponses.length; i++) { var formResponse = formResponses[i]; var itemResponses = formResponse.getItemResponses(); for (var j = 0; j < itemResponses.length; j++) { var itemResponse = itemResponses[j]; Logger.log('Response #%s to the question "%s" was "%s"', (i + 1).toString(), itemResponse.getItem().getTitle(), itemResponse.getResponse()); } }

method.name: getItem
method.doc: Gets the question item that this response answers.

method.name: getResponse
method.doc: Gets the answer that the respondent submitted.

forms.ListItem.name: ListItem
forms.ListItem.doc: ListItem A question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a drop-down list. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add a new list item. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var item = form.addListItem(); item.setTitle('Do you prefer cats or dogs?') .setChoices([ item.createChoice('Cats'), item.createChoice('Dogs') ]);

forms.MultipleChoiceItem.doc: MultipleChoiceItem A question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a list of radio buttons or an optional "other" field. forms.PageBreakItem.name: PageBreakItem
forms.PageBreakItem.doc: PageBreakItem A layout item that marks the start of a page. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Create a form and add three page-break items. var form = FormApp.create('Form Name'); var pageTwo = form.addPageBreakItem().setTitle('Page Two'); var pageThree = form.addPageBreakItem().setTitle('Page Three'); // Make the first two pages navigate elsewhere upon completion. pageTwo.setGoToPage(pageThree); // At end of page one (start of page two), jump to page three pageThree.setGoToPage(FormApp.PageNavigationType.RESTART); // At end of page two, restart form

forms.VideoItem.name: VideoItem
forms.VideoItem.doc: VideoItem A layout item that displays a video. Items can be accessed or created from a Form. // Open a form by ID and add three new video items, using a long URL, // a short URL, and a video ID. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); form.addVideoItem() .setTitle('Video Title') .setHelpText('Video Caption') .setVideoUrl('www.youtube.com/watch?v=1234abcdxyz'); form.addVideoItem() .setTitle('Video Title') .setHelpText('Video Caption') .setVideoUrl('youtu.be/1234abcdxyz'); form.addVideoItem() .setTitle('Video Title') .setHelpText('Video Caption') .setVideoUrl('1234abcdxyz');

method.name: duplicate
method.doc: Creates a copy of this item and appends it to the end of the form.

method.doc: Gets the video's horizontal alignment.

method.doc: Sets the video itself from a given YouTube URL or YouTube video ID.

argument.name: youtubeUrl
argument.doc: the YouTube URL or ID

method.name: setWidth
method.doc: Sets the video's width in pixels.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the width in pixels

forms.Alignment.name: Alignment
forms.Alignment.doc: Alignment An enum representing the supported types of image alignment. Alignment types can be accessed from FormApp.Alignment. // Open a form by ID and add a new image item with alignment var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var img = UrlFetchApp.fetch('https://www.google.com/images/srpr/logo4w.png'); form.addImageItem() .setImage(img) .setAlignment(FormApp.Alignment.CENTER);

property.name: LEFT
property.doc: Align the image to the left side of the form.

property.name: CENTER
property.doc: Align the image to the center of the form.

property.name: RIGHT
property.doc: Align the image to the right side of the form.

forms.DestinationType.name: DestinationType
forms.DestinationType.doc: DestinationType An enum representing the supported types of form-response destinations. All forms, including those that do not have a destination set explicitly, save a copy of responses in the form's response store. Destination types can be accessed from FormApp.DestinationType. // Open a form by ID and create a new spreadsheet. var form = FormApp.openById('1234567890abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'); var ss = SpreadsheetApp.create('Spreadsheet Name'); // Update the form's response destination. form.setDestination(FormApp.DestinationType.SPREADSHEET, ss.getId());

property.name: SPREADSHEET
property.doc: A Google Sheets spreadsheet as a destination for form responses.

forms.ItemType.name: ItemType
forms.ItemType.doc: ItemType An enum representing the supported types of form items. Item types can be accessed from FormApp.ItemType. // Open a form by ID and add a new section header. var form = FormApp.create('Form Name'); var item = form.addSectionHeaderItem(); item.setTitle('Title of new section'); // Check the item type. if (item.getType() == FormApp.ItemType.SECTION_HEADER) { item.setHelpText('Description of new section.'); }

property.name: CHECKBOX
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to select one or more checkboxes, as well as an optional "other" field.

property.name: DATE
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date.

property.name: DATETIME
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date and time.

property.name: DURATION
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a length of time.

property.name: GRID
property.doc: A question item, presented as a grid of columns and rows, that allows the respondent to select one choice per row from a sequence of radio buttons.

property.name: IMAGE
property.doc: A layout item that displays an image.

property.name: LIST
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a drop-down list.

property.name: MULTIPLE_CHOICE
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a list of radio buttons or an optional "other" field.

property.name: PAGE_BREAK
property.doc: A layout item that marks the start of a page.

property.name: PARAGRAPH_TEXT
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to enter a block of text.

property.name: SCALE
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to choose one option from a numbered sequence of radio buttons.

property.name: SECTION_HEADER
property.doc: A layout item that visually indicates the start of a section.

property.name: TEXT
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to enter a single line of text.

property.name: TIME
property.doc: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a time of day.

forms.PageNavigationType.name: PageNavigationType
forms.PageNavigationType.doc: PageNavigationType An enum representing the supported types of page navigation. Page navigation types can be accessed from FormApp.PageNavigationType. The page navigation occurs after the respondent completes a page that contains the option, and only if the respondent chose that option. If the respondent chose multiple options with page-navigation instructions on the same page, only the last navigation option has any effect. Page navigation also has no effect on the last page of a form. Choices that use page navigation cannot be combined in the same item with choices that do not use page navigation. // Create a form and add a new multiple-choice item and a page-break item. var form = FormApp.create('Form Name'); var item = form.addMultipleChoiceItem(); var pageBreak = form.addPageBreakItem(); // Set some choices with go-to-page logic. var rightChoice = item.createChoice('Vanilla', FormApp.PageNavigationType.SUBMIT); var wrongChoice = item.createChoice('Chocolate', FormApp.PageNavigationType.RESTART); // For GO_TO_PAGE, just pass in the page break item. For CONTINUE (normally the default), pass in // CONTINUE explicitly because page navigation cannot be mixed with non-navigation choices. var iffyChoice = item.createChoice('Peanut', pageBreak); var otherChoice = item.createChoice('Strawberry', FormApp.PageNavigationType.CONTINUE); item.setChoices([rightChoice, wrongChoice, iffyChoice, otherChoice]);

property.name: CONTINUE
property.doc: Continue to the next page of the form after completing the current page.

property.name: GO_TO_PAGE
property.doc: Jump to a specified page of the form after completing the current page.

property.name: RESTART
property.doc: Restart the form from the beginning, without clearing answers entered so far, after completing the current page.

property.name: SUBMIT
property.doc: Submit the form response after completing the current page.
